com.mapzen.android.graphics.model

Class ThemedMapStyle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapzen.android.graphics.model.MapStyle
      • com.mapzen.android.graphics.model.ThemedMapStyle
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BubbleWrapStyle, CinnabarStyle, RefillStyle, WalkaboutStyle, ZincStyle

    public abstract class ThemedMapStyle
extends MapStyle
    Abstract class for map style which supports themes.

    • Method Detail

      • getStyleRootPath

        public abstract java.lang.String getStyleRootPath()
        Returns the style's root directory. Styles should be located within the assets directory. ie. "styles/refill-style/"
        Returns:

      • getBaseStyleFilename

        public abstract java.lang.String getBaseStyleFilename()
        Returns the style's base file. ie. "refill-style.yaml"
        Returns:

      • getThemesPath

        public abstract java.lang.String getThemesPath()
        Returns the themes directory path. ie "themes/"
        Returns:

      • getDefaultLod

        public abstract int getDefaultLod()
        Returns the default detail level for the style.
        Returns:

      • getLodCount

        public abstract int getLodCount()
        Returns the total number of detail levels for the style. Detail theme filenames should be zero-based and follow the format "detail-{DETAIL-LEVEL}.yaml". ie "detail-8.yaml"
        Returns:

      • getDefaultLabelLevel

        public abstract int getDefaultLabelLevel()
        Returns the default label level for the style.
        Returns:

      • getLabelCount

        public abstract int getLabelCount()
        Returns the total number of label levels for the style. Label theme filenames should be zero-based and follow the format "label-{LABEL-LEVEL}.yaml". ie. "label-3.yaml"
        Returns:

      • getDefaultColor

        public abstract ThemeColor getDefaultColor()
        Returns the default color for the style.
        Returns:

      • getColors

        public abstract java.util.Set<ThemeColor> getColors()
        Returns colors the theme supports. Color theme filenames should follow the format "color-{THEME-COLOR}.yaml" ie. "color-pink.yaml"
        Returns:
